messageBody:
My problem is that I designed a Java GUI using TfD, and now I want to
run these unit tests, along with the rest of my tests, during my
nightly build. I'm building on a Unix machine, which means that the
java ui has to connect to an X server somewhere. If it doesn't, then
all the gui-related tests fail, since they can't open their windows.

Has anybody solved this problem before? The best answers I can come up
with are to either separate out the gui tests that require a window to
be opened (anything dealing with geometry it seems), or replace the
visible windows with in-memory windows and see if that helps.

Any suggestions are welcome...
